name: Journal of the Alchemical Society (IAPSOP)
content:
Journal of the Alchemical Society (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: Journal of the Alchemical Society Summary:  From Pat Deveney's database: Journal of the Alchemical Society, The. 1913-1915 Monthly London, England. Publisher: H.K. Lewis. Editor: H. Stanley Redgrove. Corporate author: Alchemical Society 1/1, 1913-1915. 12 pp. This was an early semi-scholarly journal devoted to the history of alchemy. The Alchemical Society had been founded in 1912 by Stanley Redgrove, W. Gorn Old, and others and viewed alchemy broadly to include extensive reviews of kabbalism, Rosicrucianism, modern alchemy and occultism generally. NYPL; University of Chicago, University of Wisconsin; J.R. Ritman Library; Glasgow University; University of Leeds; Yale University; etc. Issues:Journal of the Alchemical Society V1 1913 Journal of the Alchemical Society V2 1913-1914 Journal of the Alchemical Society V3 1914-1915
